prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a curved top edge** The first part of the CAD assembly is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a curved top edge. This part will be constructed using a single coordinate system, two faces, and one extrusion. **Coordinate System** The coordinate system for this part will be defined by the following parameters: Euler Angles: * X-axis rotation: 0.0 degrees * Y-axis rotation: 0.0 degrees * Z-axis rotation: 0.0 degrees Translation Vector: * X-axis translation: 0.0 * Y-axis translation: 0.0 * Z-axis translation: 0.0 **Faces and Loops** *Face 1* Draw a rectangle with the following curves and loops: * Line 1: + Start Point: (0.2045, 0.0) + End Point: (0.2045, 0.4091) * Arc 1: + Start Point: (0.2045, 0.4091) + Mid Point: (0.0, 0.2045) + End Point: (0.2045, 0.0) *Face 2* Draw a polygon with the following curves and loops: * Line 1: + Start Point: (0.2045, 0.0) + End Point: (0.75, 0.0) * Line 2: + Start Point: (0.75, 0.0) + End Point: (0.75, 0.4091) * Line 3: + Start Point: (0.75, 0.4091) + End Point: (0.2045, 0.4091) * Arc 1: + Start Point: (0.2045, 0.4091) + Mid Point: (0.4091, 0.2045) + End Point: (0.2045, 0.0) *Face 3* Draw a half circle with the following curves and loops: * Line 1: + Start Point: (0.2045, 0.0) + End Point: (0.2045, 0.4091) * Arc 1: + Start Point: (0.2045, 0.4091) + Mid Point: (0.4091, 0.2045) + End Point: (0.2045, 0.0) *Note: The half circle should be joined to the polygon on Face 2 to form a curved top edge.* **Extrusion** Extrude the sketch by the following dimensions: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.1091 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.75 * Operation: Create a new solid body (NewBodyFeatureOperation) **Dimensions of the Final Shape** * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.75 * Height: 0.1091 With these instructions, the junior CAD designer should be able to construct the given part to a high degree of accuracy. Please ensure all specifications are followed closely to create a reliable and precise CAD model.</description>

Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.2436, 0.0]. **1.2 Sketch Face 1** Now, create a sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. Create the first line segment with start point at [0.0, 0.3248] and end point at [0.1875, 0.0]. 2. Create the second line segment with start point at [0.1875, 0.0] and end point at [0.5625, 0.0]. 3. Create the third line segment with start point at [0.5625, 0.0] and end point at [0.75, 0.3248]. 4. Create the fourth line segment with start point at [0.75, 0.3248] and end point at [0.5625, 0.6495]. 5. Create the fifth line segment with start point at [0.5625, 0.6495] and end point at [0.1875, 0.6495]. 6. Create the sixth line segment with start point at [0.1875, 0.6495] and end point at [0.0, 0.3248]. *Loop 2* 1. Create a circle at the center point [0.375, 0.3248] with a radius of 0.2165. **1.3 Scale Sketch** Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75 using the sketch scaling parameter. **1.4 Transform Sketch to 3D** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector specified in the coordinate system. **1.5 Extrude Sketch** Extrude the 3D sketch along the normal direction with a depth of 0.2436 to generate the 3D model. Assign the appropriate boolean operation for this part, which is the creation of a new solid body. **1.6 Describe Part Geometry** The resulting part has the following geometry: - Shape: A three-dimensional, geometric shape with a hollow center, consisting of a series of interconnected, rectangular prisms. - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.2436 - Height: 0.75 Provide these instructions and the described part geometry to the junior CAD designer. The designer should be able to generate the 3D model using the provided instructions.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Long, Thin, Rectangular Prism The final shape is a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. It is centered horizontally and vertically in the image. The height of the prism is approximately three times the width of the base. The top and bottom faces of the prism are parallel to each other, and the sides of the prism are perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. The prism is the only object in the image. Face 1 Face 1 contains two loops, loop 1 and loop 2. Loop 1 * Arc 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.001], Mid Point [0.0003, 0.0003], End Point [0.001, 0.0] * Line 1: Start Point [0.001, 0.0], End Point [0.0115, 0.0] * Arc 2: Start Point [0.0115, 0.0], Mid Point [0.0122, 0.0003], End Point [0.0125, 0.001] * Line 2: Start Point [0.0125, 0.001], End Point [0.0125, 0.0178] * Arc 3: Start Point [0.0125, 0.0178], Mid Point [0.0122, 0.0185], End Point [0.0115, 0.0187] * Line 3: Start Point [0.0115, 0.0187], End Point [0.001, 0.0187] * Arc 4: Start Point [0.001, 0.0187], Mid Point [0.0003, 0.0185], End Point [0.0, 0.0178] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0178], End Point [0.0, 0.001] Loop 2 * Arc 1: Start Point [0.0008, 0.001], Mid Point [0.0008, 0.0008], End Point [0.001, 0.0008] * Line 1: Start Point [0.001, 0.0008], End Point [0.0115, 0.0008] * Arc 2: Start Point [0.0115, 0.0008], Mid Point [0.0117, 0.0008], End Point [0.0117, 0.001] * Line 2: Start Point [0.0117, 0.001], End Point [0.0117, 0.0178] * Arc 3: Start Point [0.0117, 0.0178], Mid Point [0.0117, 0.0179], End Point [0.0115, 0.018] * Line 3: Start Point [0.0115, 0.018], End Point [0.001, 0.018] * Arc 4: Start Point [0.001, 0.018], Mid Point [0.0008, 0.0179], End Point [0.0008, 0.0178] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0008, 0.0178], End Point [0.0008, 0.001] Extrusion Extrude this sketch by 0.1875 units in both directions along the normal and 0.1875 units in the opposite direction along the normal, with a scaling factor of 0.0187. The operation is to create a new solid body.</description>

<description>**Bracket Part 1** The CAD model for this part is a rectangular metal bracket with two holes on the top side, used for securing components together. The bracket has a length of 0.75 units, a width of 0.75 units, and a height of 0.0183 units. **Step 1: Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of (0, 0, 0) and a translation vector of (0, 0, 0). This will serve as the origin for our bracket. **Step 2: Sketching faces** On this coordinate system, draw four faces as described below: - **Face 1** + Loop 1: Create a circle centered at (0.0915, 0.0915) with a radius of 0.0915. + Loop 2: Create a circle centered at (0.0915, 0.0915) with a radius of 0.0348. - **Face 2** + Loop 1: Create six curves in the order of arc, arc, arc, arc, line, arc, line as follows: * Arc 1: Start at (0, 0.0915), mid-point at (0.1306, 0.1741) and end at (0.1495, 0.0208) * Arc 2: Start at (0.1495, 0.0208), mid-point at (0.2139, 0.1324) and end at (0.1887, 0.2589) * Arc 3: Start at (0.1887, 0.2589), mid-point at (0.2198, 0.5302) and end at (0.4911, 0.5613) * Arc 4: Start at (0.4911, 0.5613), mid-point at (0.6176, 0.5361) and end at (0.7292, 0.6005) * Arc 5: Start at (0.7292, 0.6005), mid-point at (0.5759, 0.6194) and end at (0.6585, 0.75) * Line 1: Start at (0.6585, 0.75) and end at (0.0915, 0.75) * Arc 6: Start at (0.0915, 0.75), mid-point at (0.1561, 0.5939) and end at (0, 0.6585) * Line 2: Start at (0, 0.6585) and end at (0, 0.0915) - **Face 3** + Loop 1: Create a circle centered at (0.0915, 0.6585) with a radius of 0.0915. + Loop 2: Create a circle centered at (0.0915, 0.6585) with a radius of 0.0348. - **Face 4** + Loop 1: Create a circle centered at (0.6585, 0.6585) with a radius of 0.0915. + Loop 2: Create a circle centered at (0.6585, 0.6585) with a radius of 0.0348. **Step 3: Extrusion** Extrude each sketch by 0.0183 units in the direction of the normal vector. Note that due to scaling operations, some parts may extrude differently than others. Scale all the sketches by a factor of 0.75 before extruding. The extrusion operation will combine the faces into a single solid body. The solid body should not intersect itself, forming a rectangular metal bracket with two holes on the top side.</description>
